annotation.spannedText: All vaccines only provide temporary immunity

classMention.mentionClass: All vaccines only provide temporary immunity

annotation.spannedText: Only recovery from natural chickenpox disease will provide lifelong immunity

classMention.mentionClass: Only recovery from natural chickenpox disease will provide lifelong immunity

annotation.spannedText: a second dose of chickenpox vaccine may be needed

classMention.mentionClass: a second dose of chickenpox vaccine may be needed

annotation.spannedText: adults exposed to natural chickenpox disease were protected from developing shingles and that there is concern that mass vaccination against chickenpox may cause a future epidemic of shingles, affecting more than 50 percent of Americans aged 10 to 44 years

classMention.mentionClass: adults exposed to natural chickenpox disease were protected from developing shingles and that there is concern that mass vaccination against chickenpox may cause a future epidemic of shingles, affecting more than 50 percent of Americans aged 10 to 44 years

annotation.spannedText: There have been documented cases of transmission of vaccine virus from a vaccinated child to household contacts, including a pregnant woman

classMention.mentionClass: There have been documented cases of transmission of vaccine virus from a vaccinated child to household contacts, including a pregnant woman

annotation.spannedText: adults exposed to natural chickenpox disease were protected from developing shingles and that there is concern that mass vaccination against chickenpox may cause a future epidemic of shingles, affecting more than 50 percent of Americans aged 10 to 44 years

classMention.mentionClass: adults exposed to natural chickenpox disease were protected from developing shingles and that there is concern that mass vaccination against chickenpox may cause a future epidemic of shingles, affecting more than 50 percent of Americans aged 10 to 44 years

annotation.spannedText: The majority of children who recover from chickenpox disease do not suffer complications and they are left with lifelong immunity to the disease

classMention.mentionClass: The majority of children who recover from chickenpox disease do not suffer complications and they are left with lifelong immunity to the disease

annotation.spannedText: The chickenpox vaccine only gives temporary immunity and leaves children vulnerable to disease later in life when complications from chickenpox can be much more serious

classMention.mentionClass: The chickenpox vaccine only gives temporary immunity and leaves children vulnerable to disease later in life when complications from chickenpox can be much more serious

annotation.spannedText: the vaccine is more reactive than it was thought to be before licensure and there are too many outstanding questions about the true adverse event profile of this live virus vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: the vaccine is more reactive than it was thought to be before licensure and there are too many outstanding questions about the true adverse event profile of this live virus vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Parents should have a choice about whether or not to vaccinate their children with the chickenpox vaccine.

classMention.mentionClass: Parents should have a choice about whether or not to vaccinate their children with the chickenpox vaccine.
